description: Latin exudāre, exsudāre (“to sweat out”), from ex- (“out, out of”) + sudāre (“to sweat”), from Proto-Indo-European *sweyd-.

verbs.description: exude (third-person singular simple present exudes, present participle exuding, simple past and past participle exuded)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To discharge through pores or incisions, as moisture or other liquid matter; to give out.
(intransitive) To flow out through the pores.
(transitive) To give off or radiate a certain quality or emotion, often strongly.
examples: Wearing that suit, Jasper just exudes class.
